key_facts: The Monmouthshire and Brecon Canal is receiving emergency water from the Usk Reservoir.
Emergency water supply costs up to £100,000 a week.
The Canal and River Trust manages the Monmouthshire and Brecon Canal.
The Trust diverted repair funds to pay for emergency water.
The Trust says the solution is not financially sustainable.
Legislation changes restricted water access to protect the River Usk.
Dry weather and climate change have worsened water shortages.
Environmentalists support water restrictions to protect habitats.
The Trust fears the canal drying would harm its historic structure.
The Trust warns of ecological damage if the canal dries.
Tourism and jobs could be affected by the canal drying.
A public petition with over 10,000 signatures urges Welsh government support.
The petition calls for long-term funding for the canal.
Welsh Water agreed to supply water without affecting drinking supplies.
The Trust says a permanent solution is urgently needed.
